fields.description: This is scoped the the landing page w/ table. Separate tickets exist for magic search and graphs on this page.

comments.body:
Some notes from today's meeting for [~dkavanagh] and [~lnajjar]:

* Need to have clear all or clear subset function
* fix accordions so they are always visible
* include selected items in accordion count (eliminates need to add complexity for showing selected items) (<x> of <y> selected)
* remove link for metric name from wireframe, add description as help bubble if needed
* fix case of accordion titles to be consistent in wireframe
* fix wireframe drop down text
* change to metrics by image and use name and ID (always do this, ID is not user friendly)
* no create metric button, users don't create metrics from the console
* More actions button title doesn't make sense, and may not be needed at all if there's no multi select for actions
* write implementation ticket for MSB for this page. May iterate on drop down design within accordions if we can find a way to use MSB instead. 

This ticket is scoped to the table only.
Hey, on the X of Y selected, is that "selected for graphing" or "selected by filter". With the later, you know how many items have been filtered out by doing simple math. Both have some use, IMHO.
The <x> items found is for the filter, the X of Y selected would be selected for graphing, IMO.
Gotcha. The "Items found" count is currently only reflecting the category count, so I'll update that, though I'll have to add the separate metrics lists for each category.

[~jloza], [~lnajjar], I wrote up a fairly large suggestion in the wireframe for this page. I would happily throw out a lot of work I've done in the past week if it meant we could get more re-use of existing common code. I think it would pay dividends down the road.

TODO:
 - group resources under headers like AWS. (EC2 by instance, instance_type, etc) (done)
 - enable column sorting, but ordering under separate headers, not across entire data set
 - stack multiple dimensions in resource column (w/ labels) (done)
 - ec2 across all category can use "all instances" in resource column (add server-side) (done)

Amazing, [~dkavanagh]! Really nice work!

One very small thing: You have a note about requires detailed monitoring on AWS, that shows up in euca when it shouldn't. That note should only display when logged in to AWS. 

Thanks!

Sorry, man, I noticed one more thing. Items in the table (such as instances) that have names should be showing the names, in our typical <name (ID)> format, please. And the labels should be, for example, "Instance" or "Volume" instead of "Instance ID" or "Volume ID"
Added lazy loading of resource names for images, instances and volumes

hey, was hoping to take care of this one myself, but code is complicated and names seem to come from somewhere codey. ;)

Issue is, in cells, labels still say, for example, "VolumeId" or "instanceId" etc when they should just say "Volume" or "Instance" or whatever, because we are showing name if available and not just ID.
I did wonder about that with my last commit. Those word come from the API itself. I can set up a mapping to translated strings.
Awesome, thank you! Sorry I couldn't just fix this myself, it's too advanced for my junior coding skills. :)

GORGEOUS! Thanks, [~dkavanagh]!

UX review passed (table view only), ready for code review. Yay!
